com.highsoft.highcharts.Common.HIChartsClasses

Class HIGauge

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.highsoft.highcharts.Common.HIChartsClasses.HISeries
      • com.highsoft.highcharts.Common.HIChartsClasses.HIGauge
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HIChartsJSONSerializable

    public class HIGauge
extends HISeries
    A gauge series. If the type option is not specified, it is inherited from chart.type. For options that apply to multiple series, it is recommended to add them to the plotOptions.series options structure. To apply to all series of this specific type, apply it to plotOptions.gauge.

    • Field Detail

      • dial

        public HIDial dial
        Options for the dial or arrow pointer of the gauge. In styled mode, the dial is styled with the .highcharts-gauge-series .highcharts-dial rule.

        Try it:

         •  Styled mode

      • overshoot

        public java.lang.Number overshoot
        Allow the dial to overshoot the end of the perimeter axis by this many degrees. Say if the gauge axis goes from 0 to 60, a value of 100, or 1000, will show 5 degrees beyond the end of the axis when this option is set to 5.

        Try it:

         •  Allow 5 degrees overshoot

        default:

         0

      • wrap

        public java.lang.Boolean wrap
        When this option is true, the dial will wrap around the axes. For instance, in a full-range gauge going from 0 to 360, a value of 400 will point to 40\. When wrap is false, the dial stops at 360.

        default:

         true

      • pivot

        public HIPivot pivot
        Options for the pivot or the center point of the gauge. In styled mode, the pivot is styled with the .highcharts-gauge-series .highcharts-pivot rule.

        Try it:

         •  Styled mode
